Class LineOrientedClient

Direct Known Subclasses:
IrcClient
public abstract class LineOrientedClient
extends SocketClient

A SocketClient that sends and receives lines.

Author:
Miorel-Lucian Palii

Constructor Detail

LineOrientedClient

public LineOrientedClient(SocketAddress address,
                          Registrar registrar,
                          SelectorProvider provider)
Builds a line-oriented client that will connect to the specified address, register with the specified registrar, and use the specified provider to open channels.

Parameters:
address - the address to connect to
registrar - the registrar which will dictate network activity
provider - the provider to use for opening channels, or null to use the default provider

LineOrientedClient

public LineOrientedClient(SocketAddress address,
                          Registrar registrar)
Builds a line-oriented client that will connect to the specified address, register with the specified registrar, and use a default provider to open channels.

Parameters:
address - the address to connect to
registrar - the registrar which will dictate network activity
Method Detail

raiseWritingEvent

protected void raiseWritingEvent(String message)
Description copied from class: SocketClient
Raises a writing event with the specified message. This is called to notify listeners when the write actually happens (since it might not immediately after the message gets queued).

Overrides:
raiseWritingEvent in class SocketClient
Parameters:
message - the message of the writing event

send

protected void send(CharSequence message)
Description copied from class: SocketClient
Queues a literal message in this client's outgoing queue.

Overrides:
send in class SocketClient
Parameters:
message - the messages to queue

scanBuffer

protected void scanBuffer(StringBuilder buffer)
Description copied from class: SocketClient
Defines how this client scans messages from its incoming buffer. Implementations should discard characters from the beginning of the buffer when a message is successfully read, but should not otherwise modify the contents of the buffer. Read messages should be announced by raising a reading event.

Specified by:
scanBuffer in class SocketClient
Parameters:
buffer - a reference to this client's incoming buffer

process

protected abstract void process(String line)
Defines how this client handles incoming lines.

Parameters:
line - the incoming line
